docs.text: binjr Linux repositories ¶ The Linux repositories for binjr provides free public downloads of binjr packages for Linux distributions based around the RPM or APT package managers. For Ubuntu or Debian Systems: How to use binjr’s APT repository? For RHEL, SLES, or Fedora Systems: How to use binjr’s RPM repository?
docs.title: binjr Linux repositories

docs.text: The Linux repositories for binjr provides free public downloads of binjr packages for Linux distributions based around the RPM or APT package managers. For Ubuntu or Debian Systems: How to use binjr’s APT repository? For RHEL, SLES, or Fedora Systems: How to use binjr’s RPM repository?
docs.title: binjr Linux repositories

docs.text: How to use binjr’s APT repository? ¶ To add the binjr apt repository on a Ubuntu or Debian system: Import binjr’s developers public keys. curl https://binjr.eu/openpgpkey/binjr_dev_pub_keys.asc | sudo apt-key add - Add the repository. sudo apt-add-repository 'deb https://repos.binjr.eu/apt stable main' Update the information about available packages. sudo apt update Install binjr. sudo apt install binjr
docs.title: How to use binjr's APT repository?

docs.text: To add the binjr apt repository on a Ubuntu or Debian system: Import binjr’s developers public keys. curl https://binjr.eu/openpgpkey/binjr_dev_pub_keys.asc | sudo apt-key add - Add the repository. sudo apt-add-repository 'deb https://repos.binjr.eu/apt stable main' Update the information about available packages. sudo apt update Install binjr. sudo apt install binjr
docs.title: How to use binjr's APT repository?

docs.text: How to use binjr’s RPM repository? ¶ To add the binjr repository on a RHEL, Centos or Fedora system: Import binjr’s developers public keys. sudo rpm --import https://binjr.eu/openpgpkey/binjr_dev_pub_keys.asc Add the repository. sudo curl -o /etc/yum.repos.d/binjr.repo https://repos.binjr.eu/rpm/binjr.repo Install binjr. sudo yum install binjr
docs.title: How to use binjr's RPM repository?

docs.text: To add the binjr repository on a RHEL, Centos or Fedora system: Import binjr’s developers public keys. sudo rpm --import https://binjr.eu/openpgpkey/binjr_dev_pub_keys.asc Add the repository. sudo curl -o /etc/yum.repos.d/binjr.repo https://repos.binjr.eu/rpm/binjr.repo Install binjr. sudo yum install binjr
docs.title: How to use binjr's RPM repository?
